diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Mrs. B exhibited all DSM-IV-TR symptoms of major depression, including a pervasive depressed mood, significant interest loss (anhedonia), poor concentration, severe appetite loss, suicidal thoughts, and physical symptoms of anxiety. Despite multiple treatment failures with various antidepressants and hospitalizations, her depression persisted. Additionally, her family history, personal history of depression, grief from multiple losses, and chronic illnesses contributed to the diagnosis of treatment-resistant depression.
